bibl.title: Letter from Albert Woldert to L. O. Howard, January 4, 1900

div1.p: Woldert suggests allowing tobacco to macerate in kerosene oil as a means to kill mosquito larvae quicker and in a more dilute solution than plain oil. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: Letter from Albert Woldert to L. O. Howard, January 4, 1900
div1.opener:
POSTAL CARD ONE CENT.
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.
THIS SIDE IS FOR THE ADDRESS ONLY.
PHILADELPHIA
JAN. 4
1901
STAD.
JEFFERSON
DIVISION OF ENTOMOLOGY
* JAN 5 1901 *
ACKNOWLEDGED
D.
Dr. L.O. Howard,
Washington,
Entomologist
U. S. Dept. Agriculture. D.C
PHILADELPHIA
JAN
6 PM
01
TRANSIT
Philadelpia, Jan. 4, 1900.
Dear Doctor Howard:
div1.p:
I notice that General Wood
has issued orders in Cuba regarding the destru
truction of mosquitos. If he will allow tobaco
co to macerate in the kereosene oil it will kill
larvae much quicker and in more dilute solution
than plain oil. The tobacco fields are close b
by. Try it. (see Jour. Amer. Med. Association
Oct 13, 1900, page 937). The larvae bite the
oil off, but they dont like tobacco.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, Albert Woldert 1706 North 16th. St.
